short_summary: Reqruitment of a psychologist for provision of specialized clinical psychological assessments
description: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) requires the services of one Psychologist to provide specialized clinical psychological assessments to address fitness for duty, disability management and performance related issues for regular and civilian members; to conduct psychological debriefings within specialized sections/deployments; to conduct psychological screening assessments for applicants to the RCMP; and provide/oversee critical incident intervention for members; and to coordinate and deliver preventative health programs in collaboration with K Division Health Services team.  The contractor must be available to provide services forty hours per week Monday to Friday and on occasions where required by the RCMP, after hours or on weekends or statutory holidays.  The contract period will be for two years from the date of contract with an irrevocable option to extend it for up to three additional one-year periods. The anticipated start date is June 1st, 2024. Basis of selection: A bid must comply with the requirements of the bid solicitation and meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be declared responsive. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award of a contract.

## Government Tender Announcement
### Tender Number: M5000-24-1333/A

#### Amendment Number: 1

#### Publication Date: 2023-08-15

#### Tender Closing Date: 2023-09-13T16:00:00

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is seeking a Psychologist to provide specialized clinical psychological assessments and services.

#### Contract Period:

* Contract duration: 2 years
* Option to extend contract for up to 3 additional 1-year periods
* Anticipated start date: June 1st, 2024

#### Services Required:

* Conduct specialized clinical psychological assessments for fitness for duty, disability management, and performance-related issues
* Provide psychological debriefings and critical incident interventions
* Conduct psychological screening assessments for applicants to the RCMP
* Coordinate and deliver preventative health programs

#### Tender Requirements:

* The Contractor must be available to provide services 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday
* Contractor may be required to work after hours, weekends, or statutory holidays as needed by the RCMP
* Tenders must comply with the requirements of the bid solicitation and meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria
* The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be selected for award of contract

#### Tender Submission:

* Tenders must be submitted to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit at NWR_Procurement_Bids@rcmp-grc.gc.ca
* Tender documents can be obtained from the attached files or through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities

#### Important Note:

* Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement
* The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada
* Indigenous Procurement opportunities are available, and interested suppliers can register for the Indigenous Business Directory at canada.ca/indigenousbusinessdirectory

### Contact Information:

* Sheena Simonson, Contracting Officer
* Email: sheena.simonson@rcmp-grc.gc.ca
* Phone: 13065151653

### Attachments:

* Tender documents can be downloaded from the attached files or through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS)
* Indigenous Business Directory registration form is available at canada.ca/indigenousbusinessdirectory
